overview.business_description: Swedish real estate company focused on social infrastructure properties (residential, community buildings) for public sector tenants. One of largest Nordic landlords. Underwent significant restructuring in 2024 including asset transfers to subsidiary holding company.
business_positives: Public sector tenants provide stable rental income
95% debt exchange completed reducing near-term default risk
Next major maturity not until Aug 2026
overview.fatal_flaw: CCC rating; insufficient liquidity for maturities; asset sales dependency; complex restructuring; EUR interest rate exposure
overview.recent_news: S&P cut to selective default on bond buyback, now CCC+. Scope CCC stable. 95% debt exchange completed Dec 2024. Sveafastigheter IPO Oct 2024. SEK 38.1bn total debt.

credit_opinion.summary: SBB is a distressed credit that has avoided near-term default through debt exchanges and asset sales (Sveafastigheter IPO). The company has bought time but fundamental challenges remain with insufficient liquidity to cover maturities without continued asset sales.
key_risks: CCC rating - very high default probability
Dependent on continued asset sales and refinancing
EUR debt creates FX mismatch with SEK assets
key_catalysts: Successful asset sales to address maturities
Swedish rate cuts supporting property values
credit_opinion.recommendation: UNDERWEIGHT - Distressed credit, high default risk
